document.masterDocTitle: New species and records of Stenus (Nestus) of the canaliculatus group, with the erection of a new species group (Insecta: Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Steninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species and records of Stenus (Nestus) of the canaliculatus group, with the erection of a new species group (Insecta: Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Steninae)

bibRefCitation.author: Ryvkin A. B.
bibRefCitation.refString: Ryvkin A. B. 1987. New species of Stenus Latreille 1796 from the Far East of the Soviet Union (Insecta: Coleoptera: Staphylinidae). Senckenbergiana biologica 68 (1 / 3): 149 - 161.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 2. – A–B :
Stenus ( Nestus ) raddei Ryvkin, 1987
: ♂ (Russia: Magadan Area: Sibit-Tyhellakh). A . Aedeagus, ventral view. B . Apical part of aedeagus, ventral view. – C–D :
S. ( N. ) illotulus Puthz, 1972
: ♂ (Russia: Amur Area: Zeyskiy Nature Reserve). C . Aedeagus, ventral view. D . Apical part of aedeagus, ventral view. Right paramere removed. – E .
S. ( N. ) confusus J. Sahlberg, 1876
: ♂ (Russia: Kalinin Area: Putilovo). Aedeagus, ventral view. – Scales = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species was originally described based on two males (HT: [ China :] Island in Sungari River; PT: [ Russia : S Maritime Province :] Kedrovaya Pad’ [Nature Reserve]); it was later cited for Hokkaido , Japan , and ‘Amur region [without more precise locality]’ ( Naomi & Puthz 1994 ). It should be noted that neither Herman (2001) nor Smetana (2004) mentioned the Chinese occurrence of this species in their respective catalogues. Both authors seem to have misinterpreted the terra typica as a Russian territory. Based on the new material above,
S. raddei
proves to be a very common species distributed widely in the Russian Far East.
